title: E06-1022

sentences.text: We present results on addressee identification in four-participants face-to-face meetings using Bayesian Network and Naive Bayes classifiers .
First , we investigate how well the addressee of a dialogue act can be predicted based on gaze , utterance and conversational context features .
Then , we explore whether information about meeting context can aid classifiers ' performances .
Both classifiers perform the best when conversational context and utterance features are combined with speaker 's gaze information .
The classifiers show little gain from information about meeting context .

Entity-both_classifier_perform_the_best_.description: The performance measure indicating which combination of features (conversational context, utterance features, and speaker's gaze information) yields the best results for addressee identification using Bayesian Network and Naive Bayes classifiers.

summary: We present results on addressee identification in four-participants face-to-face meetings using Bayesian Network and Naive Bayes classifiers . First , we investigate how well the addressee of a dialogue act can be predicted based on gaze , utterance and conversational context features . Then , we explore whether information about meeting context can aid classifiers ' performances . Both classifiers perform the best when conversational context and utterance features are combined with speaker 's gaze information . The classifiers show little gain from information about meeting context .

Predicate-present.label: present
Predicate-present.description: The predicate 'present' indicates a state of being or existence where the subject has access to or possesses the object. It implies that the subject currently holds or experiences the object, which can be physical, abstract, or intangible.

Predicate-we_investigate_how_well_the_ad.label: we investigate how well the addressee of a dialogue act can be predicted based on
Predicate-we_investigate_how_well_the_ad.description: This predicate describes an investigation into the predictive power of certain factors in determining the addressee of a dialogue act. The subject (e.g., 'First') refers to the entity conducting this investigation, while the object represents the set of features or variables being examined for their ability to predict the addressee.

Predicate-show_little_gain_from_informat.label: show little gain from information about
Predicate-show_little_gain_from_informat.description: This predicate indicates that there is a lack of significant improvement or progress when considering additional contextual information. It suggests that the subject's performance or outcome remains relatively unchanged despite having access to more details about the object, which in this case refers to meeting context.

Predicate-can_aid.label: can aid
Predicate-can_aid.description: The predicate 'can aid' indicates that the subject has the ability to contribute positively or facilitate improvement in the object, potentially enhancing its performance, accuracy, or overall effectiveness.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general concept or category represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject exemplifies or embodies the characteristics of the broader term.
